name: concrete production, 30MPa, for building construction, for interior use, with cement ZN/D, with 50% RC-C aggregates | waste concrete gravel | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27491/documentation

This dataset contains the production of concrete for use in building construction (strength class C 25/30) with cement Susteno (technical abbreviation according to SIA 2049: ZN/D) by Holcim Switzerland and 50% recycled concrete aggregates (RC-C). In its application this concrete contains reinforcement steel or other metals and is exposed to air and humidity as well as to frost-dew cycles.;Density: 2320 kg/m3, content of cement: 310 kg/m3;Exposition class according to SN EN 206: XC1, XC2, XC3;Examples for this exposition class are e.g. reinforced builing elements for interior use; construction elements that are permanently submerged under water such as foundations; concrete in an outdoor environment protected from rain such as open halls or wet spaces.

The activity starts with the ingredients for the concrete at the factory gate.

Includes the whole manufacturing processes to produce ready-mixed concrete, internal processes (transport, etc.) and infrastructure. No administration is included.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2395:Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: For some exchanges RER-modules have been used as proxy
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: New development of a resource saving, low carbon concrete by Holcim-Lafarge Switzerland.;The cement Susteno is made of processed mixed granulate from demolition projects as a major additive. The cement Susteno reduces the clinker content of the cement and contributes to a closed material cycle. The use of recycled aggregates reduces the need for landfilling and saves primary gravel and sand resources.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Composition according to standard requirements; further inputs and outpust from sampling in concrete mixing plants by Bösch, M., Haupt, M., Hellweg, S., Hirzel, R., Vadenbo, C., Gschösser, F. und Wallbaum, H. (2011): Erarbeitung von Ökobilanz-Sachbilanzdaten zur Zement- und Betonherstellung in der Schweiz; Schlussbericht vom 15. Dezember 2011. cemsuisse (Hrsg.), Bern.

flow.name: waste concrete gravel
